title: Fortnite Chapter 2 trailer leaks swimming, pogo sticks, boats, and fishing
text:
Fortnite Chapter 2 – the magic is back… at some point

There will be no Season 11 for Fortnite, but the new Battle Pass for Fortnite Chapter 2 – Season 1 looks like it’s full of surprises.

It’s looking like the prediction of Fortnite not coming back until Thursday may be accurate after all, but in the meantime there has been an important revelation: a leaked trailer for the Chapter 2 – Season 1 Battle Pass.

The world of Fortnite may have been sucked into a black hole but it was never going to stay that way, especially after artwork for the whole Chapter 2 business leaked last week.

And now a trailer for the battle pass has been leaked, via fan Skin-Tracker, confirming the Chapter 2 name and that the numbering will reset to Season 1 rather than going on to Season 11.

The trailer’s only 30 seconds long but highlights a host of brand new features, including the previously leaked speed boats, swimming, and hiding in rubbish skips (and presumably other objects).

Advertisement

Advertisement

The pogo sticks might be emotes, and the hula hoops definitely are, but the fishing seems to be a real activity that you can earn experience for.

The weapon chests have also been redesigned and you can now carry down team-mates on your shoulders when trying to escape.

It’s hard to make out too much about the new map but you can definitely see a power plant, a lighthouse, and a beach – that all seem to be brand new.

In terms of the Battle Pass itself, it seems you’ll be able level up beyond the old 100 level cap and there’s a range of new medals that can be levelled up independently, including Battle, Scavenger, and Survivor.

Whether the Battle Pass will start straight away, as soon as the game is back, is unknown, as Epic Games still hasn’t said anything official about any of this.

Fortnite Chapter 2 – at last, fishing!
